lines.gurmukhi: sPl ibrK Pl dyq ijau pwKwn mwry isir krvq sih gih pwir pwir hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sadhal Birakh Dhal Dayt Jiu Paakhaan Maaray , Siri Karavat Sahi Gahi Paari Paari Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a tree laden with fruit drops fruit to the person who throws stone at it, then it bears the pain of a saw on its head and in the form of a raft or boat takes the iron saw across the river;

lines.gurmukhi: swgr mY kwiF muKu PorIAq sIp ky ijau dyq mukqwhl AvigAw n bIcwir hY
lines.transliteration_english: Saagar Mai Kaaddhi Moukhu Dhoreeat Seep Kay Jiu , Dayt Moukataahal Avagiaa N Beechaari Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an oyster is taken out of the sea, is broken and it yields a pearl to the one who breaks it open and feels not the insult that it faces;

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Knvwrw Kwin Knq hnq Gn mwnk hIrw Amol praupkwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Khanavaaraa Khaani Khanat Hanat Ghana , Maanak Heeraa Amol Paraoupakaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a labourer strives the ore in a mine with his shovel and pick-axe and the mine rewards him with precious stones and diamonds;

lines.gurmukhi: aUK mY ipaUK ijau pRgws hoq kolU pcY Avgun kIey gun swDn kY duAwr hY ]326]
lines.transliteration_english: Ookh Mai Piookh Jiu Pragaas Hot Koloo Pachai , Avagoun Keeay Goun Saadhan Kai Duaar Hai ?326?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as sweet nectar-like juice is extracted out by putting it through a crusher, so are the evil-doers treated with sympathy and welfare by the true and saintly persons when they come to them. (326)
